newsitem.title: FRANCE: Jet Services considers routes in southern Europe.
newsitem.headline: Jet Services considers routes in southern Europe.

text.p: French road and air express distribution company, Jet Services, said it was considering the creation of air cargo routes in southern Europe.
Jet Services recently announced the launch of freighter routes between Coventry and Paris/Charles de Gaulle airport and Kassel (Germany) and CDG using 4.5-tonne capacity Metroliner aircraft.

The routes, scheduled to be launched later this month, are part of a strategy to extend the distribution network of Jet Services European subsidiary, Axor's "next-day" express service which currently covers France, the Benelux and Germany.

Jet Services, via its airline subsidiary, Air Jet, already operates a Liege-CDG freighter route and domestic all-cargo flights linking Paris with Marseille, Montpellier, Toulouse, Strasbourg and Rennes.

"The development of Axor's network is customer-driven and the indications are that there will be a need for freighter links between southern Europe, notably northern Italy and Catalonia and our hub at CDG, probably during the first quarter of 1997," a company official told Reuters.
The new routes could make stopovers at Marseille where Jet Services operates a sub-hub for south-east France traffic, the official said.
Axor also plans to open three road distribution hubs in Germany during the Autumn at Stuttgart, Hamburg and Munich, to handle express shipments, the official added.

Axor's expansion in Europe forms part of a Jet Services' investment programme, announced earlier this year and covering a one-year period, totalling Ffr33m. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
